body.p:
Paintsville Ky
Decr 30th 1865
To His Excellency
Thos E. Bramlett
Gov of Kentucky

The undersigned would respectfully represent that at the present term of the Johnson Circuit Court there being an indictment against each of them for Keeping a tipling house, they went to the commonwealths attrny and made a compromise & and paid off and discharge all the fees due & commission also amounting to $54,,00 and the suits were to be dismissed but in fact the commonwealth attony took Judgment, against all of them for $10. each & cost. this was unjust and contrary to his express agreement and prevented them from making any derense they therefore ask the remission of of each of their fines of $10 each and for all proper relief

Moses Preston
Martin Preston
Samuel Hannah

Names
Elijah Patrick
Moses. Lacey
John H Allison D S L C
H, S, Vaughan
John Howes Clerk
H E Conley
F W Nickell
Reuben Patrick

Johnson Cir Ct
Moses Preston Martin Preston & Saml Hannah
$10. each
Tipling
Remitted
29 Jany 1866

p.hi: Miss i am in formed that i am Reported a malicious man at this place Which causes me to Labour under a verry Delicate feeling i shall not make any self leave this place i hope with the feeling and only ask them to Ensure after me as to Whether i am a Deceiver or not
